{{also|Strassenbahn}} ==German== [[File:Stadtbahn Bielefeld 17 Schildesche.jpg|thumb|right|Eine Straßenbahn in {{l|de|Bielefeld}}, der einzigen Stadt mit Straßenbahnen in {{l|en|Ostwestfalen}}|upright=1.6]] ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Strassenbahn}} {{qualifier|Switzerland|Liechtenstein}} ===Etymology=== {{compound|de|Straße|Bahn}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃtraːsənˌbaːn/|[ˈʃtʀaːsn̩ˌbaːn]|[ˈʃtʀaːsənˌbaːn]|[ˈʃtraːsn̩ˌbaːn]|[ˈʃtraːsənˌbaːn]}} * {{audio|de|De-Straßenbahn.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Straßenbahnen}} # a [[streetcar]], a [[tramway]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|en}} ====Usage notes==== An urban train might drive on the streets on paths that are also used by cars, or it might move in tracks separated from the rest of the road traffic in an open-air area called {{m|de|Gleiskörper}}, and it might drive [[underground]] in [[tunnel]]s. It depends on the city whether the very same trains drive on all three tracks or whether there are different trains for the three types of tracks. In the latter case, as in {{l|de|Berlin}}, one {{w|lang=de|Nahverkehr in Berlin|distinguishes}} the three types by name, calling the one driving with the cars ''Straßenbahn'', the one on exclusive tracks {{m|de|S-Bahn}}, the ones serving the subway {{m|de|U-Bahn}}. Whereas in {{l|en|Cologne}} there is an indistinct Straßenbahn, {{l|de|U-Bahn}} or {{w|lang=en|Stadtbahn Köln|Stadtbahn}}, the {{w|lang=en|S-Bahn Rhein-Ruhr|S-Bahn}} being a means of transportation of greater distance to connect the whole urban area with its multiple cities. But in places where there isn’t such a tripartite system and a single train moves between tracks used by cars, exclusive s-train-tracks and tunnels in a single route, it is called {{m-self|de|Straßenbahn}} indistinctly, or also {{m|de|Stadtbahn}}, this last especially by the officials themselves, so in {{l|de|Bielefeld}}, the terms {{l|de|S-Bahn}} and {{l|de|U-Bahn}} being uncommon, the city being {{w|lang=de|Stadtbahn Bielefeld|surrounded}} by rural areas otherwise only having busses for local traffic. Whereas in {{l|de|Hamburg}} “{{w|lang=de|Straßenbahn Hamburg|Straßenbahn}}” is a historical term since the Straßenbahnen proper have been abolished completely by 1978. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Elektrische}} * {{l|de|Tram}} {{qualifier|Austrian Standard German}} * {{l|de|Trambahn}} * {{l|de|Tramway}} {{qualifier|Austrian Standard German}} * {{l|de|Straba}} {{q|Saxony — Würzburg}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|ru|штра́сик|bor=1}} {{q|only in Germany itself}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:DWDS}} * {{R:Duden}} * {{projectlink/Wikipedia|lang=de|Liste von Städten mit Straßenbahnen}} {{c|de|Rail transportation}}
